result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter A Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Seek and maintain employment, if agent determines he is able.    If employment is not an option, defendant to perform community service, if agent determines he is able.  Defendant to provide proof of disability to his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.


Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant is to use only one pharmacy.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with:  John Rose, Kyle Field, Rebecca (Davis) Rose, or any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Credit for 14 days, if revoked.

Defendant must contact probation within 24 hours upon release from jail, unless they have already met with him.

DNA Proof of Submission form
Faxed DNA Submission form to JASO
Associated with Charge #1

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1 and  Count 5.  Counts 2, 3, 4 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.   Defendant understood.  Victim notification complied with.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given. Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Flee Operator Flee/Elude, contrary to 346.04(3) and Poss. Firearm - Convicted of a felony, contrary to 941.29(1m)(a).  Joint recommendation for 3 yrs probation.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Seek and maintain employment. No contact with John Rose,  Kyle Field, or Rebecca Rose.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Attorney Sebion states that the defendant is unable to be employed.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 year probation, concurrent.    AODA and recommended treatment.  Seek and maintain employment.  Provide proof of disability to agent.  May do community service.  Agent to determine.  Seek GED or equivalent.   No contact with John Rose,  Kyle Field, or Rebecca Rose (Davis), or known illegal drug users or dealers .    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Only use one pharmacy The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  DNA sample and surcharge.  30 day Jail on count 5.  No credit on that jail sentence.  Subject to random drug testing.    Credit for 14 days if revoked.  upon release contact probation if they have not already met with him.

Attorney Carly Sebion waived the reading of the complaint and requests a preliminary hearing within the time limits.  Attorney Sebion is to schedule the prelim with the J.A.  Defense requests a bond reduction.  Court orders cash bond reduced to $2500 with all previously ordered conditions.
